name: Sheraton Shanghai Hotel & Residences Pudong

reviews.text: I stayed in June 2007 over a weekend.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — Rainforest shower, wardrobe accessable from both room and bathroom

reviews.text: Although the hotel is newly opened (and still has the "new" smell), the staff is just GREAT. Helpful, nothing is too much, they go out of their way to say "Hello" and assist guests with anything!
reviews.title: great hotel, not good location

reviews.text: Someone lost his mobile in a taxi and they didn't rest until the phone was returned!
reviews.title: Friendly New Hotel
New hotel - still working out the kinks
top notch hotel
reviews.text: Just took a quick 3-day getaway trip to Shanghai, and chose this hotel as part of the air-and-stay package. My first 2 choices were sold out so I had to "settle" for this hotel. I guess it's not a popular hotel because of its location (on the Pudong side, and not walkable to TV "Oriental Pearl" tower).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location may not be perfect for some, but the hotel is right on top of the subway station. It takes less than 45 mins to get from the Pudong airport using the Maglev highspeed train and subway (side note: the frenquency of the subway can be quite low during weekend, about every 15 mins). And the city is covered by multiple subway lines (up to 8 now). As a last resort, taxi is very affordable.
reviews.title: Don't drink the water

reviews.text: What impresses me the most is the well appointed guest room. Everything you need, they have it. The rain shower is a nice touch that is not often found in others. TV with lots of channels, nice bedding, separate toilet stall, I just cannot find any faults. However, I must caution about something I found in many hotels in China. For some reasons, the materials used in renovation/furnishing get worn out pretty quickly (I already found little cracks in the stone tiles in the bathroom), so rooms may not be as impressive in a couple years.
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.text: Used their gym as well, very spacious. It's set up in a long corridor style room, most equipment facing the garden, so it gives guests a very tranquil feeling while exercising. I took a peak at the pool and locker room area (which has a steam room), all very nice. And for some reasons, only few people used the facilities (I went around 6:30-7:00am), so that's great.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As part of the package, the breakfast buffet is included. Lots of items to choose from. Particularly enjoyed their pastry and cold section (cereal, salad). Great service throughout, I was able to leisurely enjoy the food, while browsing the internet (free on the ground floor of the hotel).
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Great stay, first class all the way. Location could be better.
reviews.title: Great stay, bad location

reviews.text: I have stayed here a couple times, and plan to come back. While it is a bit far as the crow flies from the Lujiazui central business area, the cab ride is really fast along the river. If you need to go across to Puxi, you probably want to find a place on the other side of the river. The hotel is also located at a subway stop which can access pretty much anywhere in the city within 45 minutes.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great service, funny location

reviews.text: The rooms are not huge, but very well executed. Cool views out over Pudong and the Yangpu bridge from upper floors.
reviews.title: Excellent value in Shanghai

likes.disliked: — Believe it or not - lack o bedside light switches.

reviews.text: Excellent breakfast. Won't do anything for your diet, but the fresh croissants are really good. Also had a good room service dinner... Nasi Goreng. Another good food option is a small grocery in the basement of the department store next door. Fresh sushi and similar items.
reviews.title: Great hotel, I enjoyed it
Good Hotel, Inconvenient Location
reviews.text: Concierges went above and beyond to help me with some issues (lost luggage).

The hotel was very nice and the staff are helpful. Location was great, and it was walking distance to the train. It was not too far from the main attractions, just a 15-20 min cab ride. The room was comfortable. Cleanliness is not a problem. Staffs are helpful. The bed is just right, you can have a good night sleep at night. It was a good stay.
reviews.title: Great modern part of China.

likes.disliked: — The concierge did not inform me that it will be pouring rain, that it might night be a good day to take the tour.

reviews.text: Stayed in Sheraton Pudong for three nights whilst on business to Shanghai. The hotel is about a year old and in good order.
reviews.title: Just about a pass mark

reviews.text: Quibbles about usual things really. Shanghai is expensive but food and drinks in this establishment do not represent good value. (Check the back of the restaurant menu and you will find set meals for 90 RMB, but no staff member will point this out)
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: Concerned also about the cost of internet access in the rooms although this is provided free of charge in the lobby area.
reviews.title: Great hotel , swish rooms

reviews.text: SPG rewards and upgrade entitlement the usual mystery with the 3 points for every $ spent simply not being credited.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, not a great tourist location

aka: Sheraton Shanghai Hotel And Residences Pudong
description: In central Pudong, metro station nearby and luxury hotel with 24h fitness center. Convenient location. In central Pudong business area, close to Int'l Exhibition Center,EXPO Center and Mercedes-Benz Arena. Easy access to places of interests both in Puxi and Pudong through Nanpu Bridge. Metro station is 1-min away. Dining and Leisure: Hotel features an indoor pool, 24-hour fitness center and a fully-service spa. Besides 2 restaurants and lobby lounge at Sheraton, guests could also sign bills at Four Points next door in restaurants and bar. Modern-equipped Guestroom: All spacious rooms are equipped with Sheraton Sweet Sleeper™ Beds, 32-inch LCD TV, mini bar, direct-dial telephones with voicemail, Internet and safebox to have laptop. Bathroom with separate bathtub and shower.
